module.description: This component is the Power Management controller. Together with the System Controller, it controls system resets and the power states of the device.

register.description: Description Register. This register provides IP module ID, revision information, instance index and standard MMR registers offset.

bitfield.description: Module identifier used to uniquely identify this IP.

Standard IP MMR block offset. Standard IP MMRs are the set of from aggregated IRQ registers till DTB.
0: Standard IP MMRs do not exist 0x1-0xF: Standard IP MMRs begin at offset of (64*STDIPOFF from the base IP address)
IP Instance ID number. If multiple instances of IP exist in the device, this field can identify the instance number (0-15).
Major revision of IP (0-15).
Minor revision of IP (0-15).

register.description: Extended Description Register. This register shows ULL IP availability and memory size configuration.

bitfield.description: System flash availability

bitenum.token: Flash size set to level 3 (Max size)
bitenum.description: Flash size set to level 3 (Max size)

bitenum.token: Flash size set to level 2
bitenum.description: Flash size set to level 2

bitenum.token: Flash size set to level 1
bitenum.description: Flash size set to level 1

bitenum.token: Flash size set to level 0 (Min size)
bitenum.description: Flash size set to level 0 (Min size)

bitfield.description: System SRAM availability

bitenum.token: SRAM size set to level 3 (Max size)
bitenum.description: SRAM size set to level 3 (Max size)

bitenum.token: SRAM size set to level 2
bitenum.description: SRAM size set to level 2

bitenum.token: SRAM size set to level 1
bitenum.description: SRAM size set to level 1

bitenum.token: SRAM size set to level 0 (Min size)
bitenum.description: SRAM size set to level 0 (Min size)

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
LPCMP (low power comparator) IP status on device

bitenum.token: IP is available
bitenum.description: IP is available

bitenum.token: IP is unavailable
bitenum.description: IP is unavailable

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description: Shutdown Register. This register controls SHUTDOWN mode entry.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Setting a valid key will trigger the device to enter SHUTDOWN mode.

bitenum.token: This is the only valid key value that will trigger SHUTDOWN mode. All other values are invalid and will have no effect.
bitenum.description: This is the only valid key value that will trigger SHUTDOWN mode. All other values are invalid and will have no effect.

register.description: Sleep Control Register. This register controls I/O pad sleep mode. When I/O pad sleep mode is enabled all I/O pad outputs and I/O pad configurations are latched. Inputs are transparent if I/O pad is configured as input.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

The boot code will set this bit field and disable sleep mode, automatically unless waking up from a SHUTDOWN RSTSTA.SDDET is set. Application software must reconfigure the state for all IO's before setting this bit field upon waking up from a SHUTDOWN to avoid glitches on pins.

bitenum.token: I/O pad sleep mode is disabled
bitenum.description: I/O pad sleep mode is disabled

bitenum.token: I/O pad sleep mode is enabled
bitenum.description: I/O pad sleep mode is enabled

register.description: Wakeup Status Register This register shows the device wakeup source. Used to distinguish between wakeup from STANDBY, SHUTDOWN and reset.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
This field shows the device wakeup source.

bitenum.token: Wakeup from STANDBY mode.
bitenum.description: Wakeup from STANDBY mode.

bitenum.token: Wakeup from system reset / SHUTDOWN mode. See RSTSTA for more status information.
bitenum.description: Wakeup from system reset / SHUTDOWN mode. See RSTSTA for more status information.

register.description: VDDR Control Register. This register contains VDDR regulator settings for the device.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Select between continuous or duty-cycled VDDR regulation in STANDBY mode.

bitenum.token: Continuous VDDR regulation in STANDBY mode.
bitenum.description: Continuous VDDR regulation in STANDBY mode.

bitenum.token: Duty-cycled VDDR regulation in STANDBY mode.
bitenum.description: Duty-cycled VDDR regulation in STANDBY mode.

bitfield.description: Select between GLDO and DCDC as VDDR regulator (in ACTIVE, IDLE and STANDBY mode).

bitenum.token: DCDC enabled for regulation of VDDR voltage
bitenum.description: DCDC enabled for regulation of VDDR voltage

bitenum.token: GLDO enabled for regulation of VDDR voltage
bitenum.description: GLDO enabled for regulation of VDDR voltage

register.description: Reset Control Register. This register configures and controls system reset.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
VDD glitch monitor delay. This bit configures if exit out of STANDBY will be stalled until VGM has settled or not. When bypassed the CPU execution will potentially start before the VGM is ready.

bitenum.token: VGM settling will not stall exit out of STANDBY.
bitenum.description: VGM settling will not stall exit out of STANDBY.

bitenum.token: Ensure that VGM has settled before we exit STANDBY.
bitenum.description: Ensure that VGM has settled before we exit STANDBY.

bitfield.description: LF clock loss reset enable. Trigger system reset when LF clock loss is detected, which reset the entire device and causes a reboot of the system. The system reset event is captured as RSTSTA.RESETSRC set to SYSRESET and RSTSTA.SYSSRC set to LFLOSSEV.

bitenum.token: LF clock loss detection will trigger a system reset.
bitenum.description: LF clock loss detection will trigger a system reset.

bitenum.token: LF clock loss detection will not trigger a system reset.
bitenum.description: LF clock loss detection will not trigger a system reset.

bitfield.description: TSD (Thermal Shutdown) enable. TSD will trigger an immediate system reset, which reset the entire device and causes a reboot of the system. The device will be in reset until released by the TSD IP. The system reset event is captured as RSTSTA.TSDEV flag set.

bitenum.token: Temperature shutdown comparator enable. Note: If TSD IP not present, see DESCEX.TSD, enable will have no effect.
bitenum.description: Temperature shutdown comparator enable. Note: If TSD IP not present, see DESCEX.TSD, enable will have no effect.

bitenum.token: No effect
bitenum.description: No effect

bitfield.description: Trigger system reset, which will reset the entire device and causes a reboot of the system. The system reset event is captured as RSTSTA.RESETSRC set to SYSRESET and RSTSTA.SYSSRC set to SYSRSTEV.

bitenum.token: Trigger a system reset.
bitenum.description: Trigger a system reset.

bitenum.token: No effect
bitenum.description: No effect

register.description: Reset Status. This register contains the reset source and SHUTDOWN wakeup source for the system. Check WUSTA.SRC first to ensure that wakeup from STANDBY is not set. The capture feature is not rearmed until all of the possible reset sources have been released and the result has been copied to this register. During the copy and rearm process it is one 24MHz period in which an eventual new system reset will be reported as Power on reset regardless of the root cause.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Wakeup from SHUTDOWN flag. Note: This flag will be cleared when SLPCTL.SLPN is asserted.

bitenum.token: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN mode
bitenum.description: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN mode

bitenum.token: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN mode not triggered.
bitenum.description: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN mode not triggered.

bitfield.description: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN on an I/O event flag. Note: This flag will be cleared when SLPCTL.SLPN is asserted.

bitenum.token: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN triggered by an I/O event.
bitenum.description: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN triggered by an I/O event.

bitenum.token: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN not triggered by an I/O event.
bitenum.description: Wakeup from SHUTDOWN not triggered by an I/O event.

bitfield.description: RTC TIME reset status. This bit shows if the last system reset event cleared RTC TIME or not.

bitenum.token: System reset event did not clear RTC TIME
bitenum.description: System reset event did not clear RTC TIME

bitenum.token: System reset event cleared RTC TIME
bitenum.description: System reset event cleared RTC TIME

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Shows which reset event that triggered SYSRESET in RESETSRC.

bitenum.token: Digital Error reset event
bitenum.description: Digital Error reset event

bitenum.token: Analog Error reset event
bitenum.description: Analog Error reset event

bitenum.token: SRAM parity error event
bitenum.description: SRAM parity error event

bitenum.token: Tamper event
bitenum.description: Tamper event

bitenum.token: Electromagnetic sensor event
bitenum.description: Electromagnetic sensor event

bitenum.token: Analog FSM timeout event
bitenum.description: Analog FSM timeout event

bitenum.token: Serial Wire Debug reset event
bitenum.description: Serial Wire Debug reset event

bitenum.token: System reset event
bitenum.description: System reset event

bitenum.token: Watchdog timeout event
bitenum.description: Watchdog timeout event

bitenum.token: CPU LOCKUP event
bitenum.description: CPU LOCKUP event

bitenum.token: CPU reset event
bitenum.description: CPU reset event

bitenum.token: LF clock loss event
bitenum.description: LF clock loss event

bitfield.description: System reset triggered by TSD event

bitenum.token: System reset triggered by TSD event
bitenum.description: System reset triggered by TSD event

bitenum.token: TSD event not triggered
bitenum.description: TSD event not triggered

bitfield.description: Shows the root cause of the last system reset. More than one reported reset source can have been active during the last system reset, but only the root cause is reported. If reset cause is SYSRESET or PINRESET, the other reset flags must be read to determine actual root cause.

bitenum.token: VDD glitch detection reset
bitenum.description: VDD glitch detection reset

bitenum.token: Digital system reset. Actual root cause is given by SYSSRC.
bitenum.description: Digital system reset. Actual root cause is given by SYSSRC.

bitenum.token: Brown out detect on VDDR
bitenum.description: Brown out detect on VDDR

bitenum.token: Brown out detect on VDDS
bitenum.description: Brown out detect on VDDS

bitenum.token: Reset pin. TSD will also trigger a pin reset, so actual root cause is given by TSDEV reset flag status.
bitenum.description: Reset pin. TSD will also trigger a pin reset, so actual root cause is given by TSDEV reset flag status.

bitenum.token: Power on reset
bitenum.description: Power on reset

register.description: AON Register Status 1. This register contains the general purpose AON flags for SW, and is updated through AONRSET1.FLAG and AONRCLR1.FLAG. The register is only reset on a POR event.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
VDDIO power good. Controls the I/O pads on the VDDIO segment.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
State of the AON register flags

register.description: AON Register Set 1. This register sets the AON flags that can be read through AONRSTA1.FLAG.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Write 1 to set AONRSTA1.VDDIOPGIO.

bitenum.token: Set flag
bitenum.description: Set flag

bitenum.token: No effect
bitenum.description: No effect

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Write 1 to set AONRSTA1.FLAG

bitenum.token: Set all flags
bitenum.description: Set all flags

bitenum.token: No flags changed status
bitenum.description: No flags changed status

register.description:
AON register clear 1
Clear the AON flags that can be read through AONRSTA1.FLAG

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Write 1 to clear AONRSTA1.VDDIOPGIO.

bitenum.token: Clear flag
bitenum.description: Clear flag

bitenum.token: No effect
bitenum.description: No effect

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Write 1 to clear AONRSTA1.FLAG

bitenum.token: Clear all flags
bitenum.description: Clear all flags

bitenum.token: No flags changed status
bitenum.description: No flags changed status

register.description: Delta Time Register. This register contains the measured delta time during wakeup from STANDBY mode.

bitfield.description: Slow part. States which of HFXT ready or SW ready that completed first during wakeup from STANDBY mode.

bitenum.token: No valid measurement available
bitenum.description: No valid measurement available

bitenum.token: HFXT ready set after SW ready (SWSTMP.SWRDY)
bitenum.description: HFXT ready set after SW ready (SWSTMP.SWRDY)

bitenum.token: HFXT ready set before SW ready (SWSTMP.SWRDY)
bitenum.description: HFXT ready set before SW ready (SWSTMP.SWRDY)

bitenum.token: No valid measurement available
bitenum.description: No valid measurement available

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Delta time. Measured time in us between SWSTMP.SWRDY and HFXT ready. This is a always a positive number, and SLWP is used to determine which event occurred first. Measurement is enabled when PREPUCTL.WUTIMEN is set.

register.description: WakeUp Time Register. This register contains the measured wakeup times from STANDBY mode.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Digital wakeup time. Gives the time (in us) from HFSOC is running until CPU execution starts. Measurement is enabled when PREPUCTL.WUTIMEN is set.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
HFXT wakeup time. Gives the time (in us) from HFSOC is running until HFXT auto enable is triggered. Measurement is enabled when PREPUCTL.WUTIMEN is set.

register.description: Pre Power-Up Control Register. This register contains settings and control for pre-powerup, STANDBY and wakeup measurements.

bitfield.description: Pre powerup Enable. When this bit is set, the device will start the wakeup process in advance of the RTC wakeup event. This to start HFXT settling earlier, so that HFXT can be ready when SW is ready. Note that HFXTCTL.AUTO must be enabled to turn on HFXT.

bitenum.token: Enable pre-powerup
bitenum.description: Enable pre-powerup

bitenum.token: Disable pre-powerup
bitenum.description: Disable pre-powerup

bitfield.description: Wakeup time measurement enable. When set will enable WUTIME.DIGWU, WUTIME.HFXTWU and DELTA.TIME time measurements.

bitenum.token: Enable wakeup time measurement
bitenum.description: Enable wakeup time measurement

bitenum.token: Disable wakeup time measurement
bitenum.description: Disable wakeup time measurement

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Conservative pre-wakeup time. When PREPUEN is set, the device will start the wakeup process in advance of the RTC wakeup event. This field will give the conservative time in advance of a RTC event. Conservative value is used if a temperature change has been detected since STANDBY mode was entered. The time unit for the value is 8us.

bitenum.token: Highest possible value
bitenum.description: Highest possible value

bitenum.token: Smallest value
bitenum.description: Smallest value

bitfield.description: Nominal pre-wakeup time. When PREPUEN is set, the device will start the wakeup process in advance of the RTC wakeup event. This field will give the nominal time in advance of a RTC event. Nominal value is used if no temperature change has been detected since STANDBY mode was entered. The time unit for the value is 8us.

bitenum.token: Highest possible value
bitenum.description: Highest possible value

bitenum.token: Smallest value
bitenum.description: Smallest value

register.description: SW Time Stamp Register. This register is used to set the SW time stamp for the delta time measurement.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
SW ready. Set by SW to indicate when SW is ready. Used to measure DELTA.TIME and DELTA.SLWP. This bit is auto-cleared by HW.

bitenum.token: Set SW ready time stamp. Auto-cleared by HW
bitenum.description: Set SW ready time stamp. Auto-cleared by HW

bitenum.token: No effect
bitenum.description: No effect

register.description: HFXT Control Register. This register controls features to turn on/off HFXT automatically.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
LF Calibration Enable. Turn on/off HFXT periodically to perform LF oscillator calibration. LF oscillator period and measurement time is configured through LFCAL.

bitenum.token: HFXT on/off periodically for LF calibration is enabled.
bitenum.description: HFXT on/off periodically for LF calibration is enabled.

bitenum.token: HFXT on/off periodically for LF calibration is disabled.
bitenum.description: HFXT on/off periodically for LF calibration is disabled.

bitfield.description: Turn on/off HFXT during STANDBY entry/exit.

bitenum.token: HFXT turned off when entring STANDBY and turned on when leaving STANDBY.
bitenum.description: HFXT turned off when entring STANDBY and turned on when leaving STANDBY.

bitenum.token: HFXT is neither turned on/off during STANDBY entry/exit
bitenum.description: HFXT is neither turned on/off during STANDBY entry/exit

register.description: Low Frequency Calibration Register. This register contains the period and measurement time setting used for LF oscillator calibration. The LF calibartion feature is enabled through HFXTCTL.LFCAL.

bitfield.description: CKM qualifier configuration. Used to qualify that LF calibration is completed before HFXT is request off.

bitenum.token: Enable CKM qualifier
bitenum.description: Enable CKM qualifier

bitenum.token: Disable CKM qualifier
bitenum.description: Disable CKM qualifier

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
LFCAL measurment time, given in number of 32kHz periods.

bitenum.token: Maximum LFCAL measurment time
bitenum.description: Maximum LFCAL measurment time

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
LFCAL period time, given in number of 256 * 32kHz periods.
